uc:usecase.uc:name: Modify Master Data
uc:usecase.uc:goal: Possibility to view all the transactions related to an account.
uc:usecase.uc:stakeholder: Merchant wants to view and modify it's master data set.
Service Provider wants to enable the customer to maintain master data.

uc:guarantees.uc:success: Merchant could view and modify successfully the master data and has been notified about the changes.
uc:guarantees.minimal: Merchant is notified about the failure of the modification or why the master data were not available.

uc:success.uc:step: Merchant enters master data configuration view.
System checks, if merchant is logged in.

System displays the master data set:
contact data link to submit the changed data
and an additional block to change the password:
new password new password retyped link to submit the changed password

uc:extension.name: CHANGE MASTER DATA
uc:extension.uc:step: System checks, if the master data has been set correctly.
System stores the new master data and returns to .

uc:extension.name: CHANGE PASSWORD
uc:extension.uc:step: System checks password against system rules.
System compares new password and the retyped new password against each other.

uc:extension.name: INVALID MASTER DATA
uc:extension.uc:step: System notifies merchant which parts of the master data were set wrongly and returns to

uc:extension.name: PASSWORD RULE VIOLATION
uc:extension.uc:step: System notifies merchant why the password could not be set and returns to .

uc:extension.name: RETYPED PASSWORD NOT EQUAL
uc:extension.uc:step: System notifies merchant why the password could not be set and returns to .
